subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Thursday, 07 June, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Viduka makes switch to Newcastle
Newcastle complete the signing of Mark Viduka on a two-year contract with the option of a third year.



 
Madrid move for Chelsea's Robben
Real Madrid are in talks with Chelsea to sign Dutch winger Arjen Robben.



 
Reina pens new Liverpool contract
Liverpool goalkeeper Jose Reina signs a new contract that keeps him at the club until 2012.








GOLF




Storm surges into Austrian lead
England's Graeme Storm fires a first-round 63 to lead the BA-CA Open by one shot in Austria



 
BA-CA Open leaderboard
Score updates from the European Tour event in Vienna.



 
Mickelson will be fit for US Open
Phil Mickelson says his wrist injury will not stop him playing at the US Open despite pulling out of this week's St Jude Championship in Memphis.








MOTORSPORT




McLaren boss feels for Raikkonen
McLaren boss Ron Dennis says he takes no pleasure in former driver Kimi Raikkonen's struggles at Ferrari.



 
Rossi confident of Catalunya win
Valentino Rossi believes he can continue his winning run of form in Sunday's Catalunya MotoGP.



 
Hamilton criticised by Villeneuve
Former world champion Jacques Villeneuve accuses rising star Lewis Hamilton of "chopping" rivals at the start of Grands Prix.








FORMULA ONE




McLaren boss feels for Raikkonen
McLaren boss Ron Dennis says he takes no pleasure in former driver Kimi Raikkonen's struggles at Ferrari.



 
Hamilton criticised by Villeneuve
Former world champion Jacques Villeneuve accuses rising star Lewis Hamilton of "chopping" rivals at the start of Grands Prix.



 
Massa predicts Ferrari fightback
Ferrari will bounce back from a poor Monaco Grand Prix to contest victory in Canada, says driver Felipe Massa.








ATHLETICS




Tomlinson looking for Osaka boost
British long jumper Chris Tomlinson says he hopes to put his injury problems behind him at this year's World Championships in Osaka.



 
Gebrselassie targets hour mark
Ethiopian distance-running great Haile Gebrselassie will attempt to break the world one-hour record this year.



 
Pickering wins battle of Britain
Craig Pickering wins the battle of the Brits as he storms home in the all-British 100m at the Glasgow Grand Prix.








CYCLING




Tour takes Riis off winners list
Tour de France organisers say they no longer consider Bjarne Riis the 1996 race winner after his drugs confession.



 
Belgian police make doping raids
A physiotherapist from Belgian cycling team Quick Step is being questioned after a series of drugs raids.



 
Thomas toasts 'dream' Tour place
Wales's Geraint Thomas is celebrating a "dream come true" with his ride in next month's Tour de France confirmed.








FUN AND GAMES




Comment: Becks for good
Robbo on Beckham's return for England



 
Hatton gets new nickname
Boxer changing his name to the 'Manchester Mexican'



 
Ten to Tackle
Test your knowledge of the last seven days in sport
